title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
description:
Bug 38131ajc needs -d option. I am using 1.1rc1. This is a regression since rc1 and a deviation from javac. I am guessing this may have something to do with a change in the underlying Eclipse compiler. Create a class in a subpackage such as:

```java
package subpackage;

public class Test {

  public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println("Hello");
  }

}
```

Then compile using the following command:

```
ajc -d subpackage subpackage\Test.java
```

You will see a directory "subpackage" created under the existing "subpackage" directory. 

```java
subpackage\Test.java
```

or

```
javac -d subpackage subpackage\Test.java
```

No big deal, really.
OB: When compiling the `Test` class using the `ajc` command with the provided parameters, a directory "subpackage" is being created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: When compiling the `Test` class using the `ajc` command with the provided parameters, a directory "subpackage" should not be created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
SR:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the `Test` class using the `ajc` command with the `-d` option and the specified subpackage path:

```
ajc -d subpackage subpackage\Test.java
```
